author:
Diamond Leung

dleung@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Clippers rout Warriors in exhibition
text:
Clippers rout Warriors in exhibition By Diamond Leung Posted: 10/20/2015 10:29:24 PM PDT Updated: 10/20/2015 10:43:43 PM PDT LOS ANGELES -- The Warriors without Stephen Curry, Andrew Bogut and Andre Iguodala in a preseason game looked as one might imagine in a loss to the Los Angeles Clippers. 
Out of sorts with Curry and Iguodala resting, the Warriors were routed by the Clippers 130-95 on Tuesday in an ugly game perhaps better remembered for the number of technical fouls stemming from both sides bickering at referees and occasionally each other. 
Five technical fouls were assessed to the Clippers, and three were called on the Warriors, excluding the ones for defensive three seconds. Six of those technical fouls came in the third quarter when there were noticeable flare-ups. 
Blake Griffin got his arm tangled up with Shaun Livingston, who was whistled for a loose-ball foul. The two faced one another and exchanged words. On the other end of the court, Draymond Green was called for an offensive foul after charging into Griffin. Green and the Clippers' Lance Stephenson were called for double technical fouls on their way back down the court. 
Later, Chris Paul was assessed two technical fouls in a row while barking at an official and was ejected. 
"I've got two kids of my own," Paul was heard on the television broadcast telling the official. "Don't talk to me like I'm a little kid." 
Jason Thompson picked up a technical after a hard foul of the Clippers' Austin Rivers. Advertisement 
Even Warriors interim head coach Luke Walton got T'd up in the first half as his team fell to 2-4 in a preseason slate without Steve Kerr, who was seen in the locker room before the game. 
Klay Thompson led the Warriors with 21 points on a night when they committed 23 turnovers. 
By halftime, the Warriors already trailed 67-43 with Griffin having racked up 23 of his game-high 29 points while Paul dished out 10 assists. 
The Warriors expect to get a better look at their team in their preseason finale on Thursday in Anaheim against the Los Angeles Lakers when Walton gives his regulars more playing time. 
Curry and Iguodala are expected to return to action against the Lakers while Bogut following minor nose surgery is hopeful to play in next week's season opener against the New Orleans Pelicans, according to Walton. 
Harrison Barnes had six points and six rebounds in his return to the lineup after missing two games due to a bone bruise in his right knee. Walton said he has looked good in practices. 
"We see a lot more in practice than we do in games where it's just scripted minutes," Walton said. "He's looked great in the preseason and has added post-up moves to his game. He's shooting the ball better. He's ballhandling better." 
In a survey of NBA general managers conducted by NBA.com , more of the executives think the Cleveland Cavaliers and San Antonio Spurs will win the championship this season than the Warriors. 
Walton joked about how some general managers make mistakes. 
"What draft pick did we get Steph? OK, so at least six of them don't know what they're doing," Walton said, smiling. "What pick did we get Draymond at?" 
The Warriors got respect as well with most general managers voting the Warriors to finish first in the Western Conference and team with the best home court advantage, Curry as the best point guard, Iguodala as the bench player that makes the biggest impact and Ron Adams as the best assistant coach. 
The Warriors for the second year in a row were voted most fun team to watch and Curry as the best pure shooter. 
Asked once again what he meant by his comments about the Warriors and luck needed to win the championship, Clippers coach Doc Rivers said, "I've answered this 100 times, so I'm pretty much done with it, you know? I think everyone knows what I said." 
Player development coach Steve Nash, a Los Angeles-area resident, attended shootaround. For more on the Warriors, see the Inside the Warriors blog at www.ibabuzz.com/warriors . Follow Diamond Leung on Twitter at twitter.com/diamond83 . ---
